title: Vue 'key' Attribute

metadata.description: Learn about Vue 'key' Attribute with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Vue Built-in Attributes Reference

Example
The
key
attribute is used on
food-item
components to uniquely identify each element created with
v-for
.
<food-item
  v-for="x in foods"
  :key="x.name"
  :food-name="x.name"
  :food-desc="x.desc"
  :is-favorite="x.favorite"
/>
Run Example »
Definition and Usage
The
key
attribute is used with the
v-for
directive so that Vue can tell the elements apart properly.
Vue optimizes performance by reusing elements. So when elements are created from an array with
v-for
, if the
key
attribute is NOT used, element properties can be mixed when the array gets modified.
For a more thorough explanation, and an example of what goes wrong when the
key
attribute is not used, see
The 'key' Attribute
chapter in the Vue tutorial.

Vue v-for Directive

Vue Tutorial:
Vue Animations with v-for

summary: This tutorial covers Vue 'key' Attribute concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Vue 'key' Attribute effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Vue 'key' Attribute and how to apply it in your projects.
